Issues.Title: fix(forms): ValueAccessor.writeValue(...) sometimes called with null
Issues.Body:
Fixes #14988
Fixes [@ckelley7's marriage](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/14988#issuecomment-396342060)

The PR is a draft for the moment as I work on adding integration tests

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
(technically no, but no doc changes were needed)

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
`ValueAccessor.writeValue(...)` is called twice on the very first `ngModel` change if the form has not yet been set up; once by `setUpControl` and once when the value is actually updated. However, because `setUpControl` is called before the value is set, the first call passes `null`.

The bug is most common for standalone form controls which are never set up before the first `ngModel` change but may also happen if any other form control is not added to its parent first by calling `NgForm.addControl(...)`.

Issue Number: #14988


## What is the new behavior?
Optionally skip the `writeValue(...)` call in `setUpControl` if we're inside a model change callback.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(forms): ValueAccessor.writeValue(...) sometimes called with null" (#38140)

Issues.Title: fix(core): ICU expression previous value not removed inside template
Issues.Body:
Fixes an issue where the previous value of an ICU expression wasn't being
removed, if it didn't have an `other` parameter and it's the last value inside
a template. The issue seems to be due to the fact that we were resetting
the index of the active expression if we didn't manage to match a value
to it which prevented the previous node from being cleaned up on the
next template run.

Also cleans up an optional parameter in one of the internal functions and
adds stronger typing to the i18n unit tests.

Fixes #38073.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): ICU expression previous value not removed inside template" (#38130)

Issues.Title: build(language-service): Remove ls_rollup_bundle (#38086)
Issues.Body:
This is a patch PR for https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/38086

`ls_rollup_bundle` is no longer needed since we could invoke `ng_rollup_bundle`
directly.

Background: language service runs rollup to produce a single file to reduce
startup time in the editor. However, due to the need to load dynamic versions
of typescript at runtime (think the case where users can change typescript
version in their editor), we hack the "banner" to export a CommonJS default function,
so that we could dynamically load the typescript module provided at runtime via AMD
and use it throughout the implementation.

PR Close #38086

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): properly associate source spans for implicitly closed elements
Issues.Body:
HTML is very lenient when it comes to closing elements, so Angular's parser has rules that specify which elements are implicitly closed when closing a tag. The parser keeps track of the nesting of tag names using a stack and parsing a closing tag will pop as many elements off the stack as possible, provided that the elements can be implicitly closed. For example, consider the following templates: - `

`, the `
` is implicitly closed when parsing ``, ¬† because `
` is a void element. - `

`, the `

` is implicitly closed when parsing ``, ¬† as `

` is allowed to be closed by the closing of its parent element. - `

  • A
  • B
`, the first `
  • ` is implicitly closed when parsing ¬† the second `
  • `, whereas the second `
  • ` would be implicitly closed when ¬† parsing the ``. In all the cases above the parsed structure would be correct, however the source span of the closing `` would incorrectly be assigned to the element that is implicitly closed. The problem was that closing an element would associate the source span with the element at the top of the stack, however this may not be the element that is actually being closed if some elements would be implicitly closed. This commit fixes the issue by assigning the end source span with the element on the stack that is actually being closed. Any implicitly closed elements that are popped off the stack will not be assigned an end source span, as the implicit closing implies that no ending element is present. Note that there is a difference between self-closed elements such as `` and implicitly closed elements such as ``. The former does have an end source span (identical to its start source span) whereas the latter does not. Fixes #36118 Resolves FW-2004
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): properly associate source spans for implicitly closed elements" (#38126)

Issues.Title: Configure option to use standard JSON.stringify instead of Angular's own implementation on HttpClient post
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/common/http - HttpClient

### Description
Would like the ability to use the standard Javascript JSON.stringify() method when the body is serialized, rather than Angular's "simplified" version.  Alternately, Angular's version should call toJSON() on any objects in the graph that implement it.

The specific issue I'm having is that I have a parent object and a related child object.  The assigned child object can be changed on the client, and while I am in the client, I want the child object to be the fully-fledged child.  However, when I post the parent object back to the server to save it, I only want the *id* (and a few other properties) of the child object sent, not it's full graph.  An obvious way to do this would be to override the toJSON() method on the child object, but Angular apparently ignores it when serializing.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Option to use the standard JSON.stringify() method, or Angular respects any toJSON() overrides.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Looked into related issue https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/32117, which suggests using an interceptor.  This is overkill for us.  The main issue is that we have been sending extra unnecessary data to our server on the save call, so it hasn't been a high priority, however due to recent server-side changes it's now a problem having the extra object.  Will null it out on the server (keeping only the ID) rather than cloning the object (minus the extra properties) on the client.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Configure option to use standard JSON.stringify instead of Angular's own implementation on HttpClient post" (#38117)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): [ivy] do not retrieve ts.Program at startup
Issues.Body:
This commit removes compiler instantiation at startup.
This is because the constructor is invoked during the plugin loading phase,
in which the project has not been completely loaded.

Retrieving `ts.Program` at startup will trigger an `updateGraph` operation,
which could only be called after the Project has loaded completely.
Without this change, the Ivy LS will throw when the tsserver proxy is created.

Note that the whole `Compiler` class is temporary, so changes made there are
only for development. Once we have proper integration with ngtsc the
`Compiler` class would be removed.

Issues.Title: Compilation: Out of Memory Exception due to combineLatest + 7+ Observables + Object Merge
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Maybe @angular/compiler or @angular/compiler-cli ### Is this a regression? Unclear ### Description Using RxJS combineLatest with `7 or more` Observables in an array and `merging` all values into one single object using the `spread operator` results in high memory cosumption - sometimes I get a node.js out of memory exception. The memory rises at compilation time (ng build, ng serve, ng test). We created a repository with sample code, workarounds and performance insights: https://github.com/qupaya/ng-example-obj-spread-bug The code which causes high memory consumption at compilation time (https://github.com/qupaya/ng-example-obj-spread-bug/blob/main/src/app/app.component.ts#L70): ```ts this.sevenPropsBrokenResult$ = combineLatest( [a$, b$, c$, d$, e$, f$, g$] ).pipe(map( ([a, b, c, d, e, f, g]) => ({ ...a, ...b, ...c, ...d, ...e, ...f, ...g }), )); ``` Memory & time consumption at compilation `/usr/bin/time -l ng build` ```ts 46.85 real 37.37 user 5.53 sys 1936789504 maximum resident set size 0 average shared memory size 0 average unshared data size 0 average unshared stack size 980706 page reclaims 4458 page faults 0 swaps 0 block input operations 0 block output operations 0 messages sent 0 messages received 2 signals received 8570 voluntary context switches 174244 involuntary context switches ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repo: https://github.com/qupaya/ng-example-obj-spread-bug Just clone the repo, run npm install and call `ng build` (or `/usr/bin/time -l ng build` if you want to monitor time and memory). ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: perf(router): don't preload already loaded route configs
Issues.Body:
For now preloading process is running every `NavigationEnd` event,
even route configs are loaded, that increases scripting time.
Would be better to preload only route configs that are not loaded yet.
These changes allow to preload router configs either:
first `NavigationEnd` event & every router config changes via `Router#resetConfig`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(router): don't preload already loaded route configs" (#38115)

Issues.Title: scrollPositionRestoration enabled by default
Issues.Body: scrollPositionRestoration option in routing should be the default behaviour in routing unless it is disabled. This is a helpful behaviour that a web application can have. Please consider this for next release

Issues.Title: Build Optimizer marks unpure code as pure
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

I don't think so as this is related to library update and not to Angular update


### Description
After updating Swiper library to 6.0.4 it becomes broken in Angular context. Building separately with Webpack in Production mode works as expected.

I investigated the problem a bit and now I'd say that it's because of "sideEffects: false" in their package.json. If I understand correctly side effects and "pure" modules are different things, or? Anyway, build optimizer's webpack loader marks some code as PURE when it isn't.

At first I've [created issue](https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/issues/3708) in Swiper's repo but maintainer says that Webpack's tree shaking works as expected. And that is true.
Here is why I decided to create issue here. Thanks!


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Here is the repl. I used simplified contents of the file that caused the issue in my case but there are another files with similar issues as well.

https://repl.it/repls/UnwittingFrivolousSystemsanalysis#index.js

The problematic place in output:
```
/*@__PURE__*/ /*@__PURE__*/ Object.keys(Methods).forEach(function (methodName) {
    $.fn[methodName] = Methods[methodName];
});
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build Optimizer marks unpure code as pure" (#18297)

Issues.Body:
This change prevents import statements from being added to commonjs files when downleveling helpers are needed.  These imports would then cause webpack to assume that the file is an ES module and potentially break the commonjs file.

Fixes #18284

Issues.Title: Angular 9+ incorrectly flags template variables as not existing in pug templates
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] serve ### Is this a regression? Yes, had no issues in Angular 8. I'm guessing this has something to do with Ivy. ### Description TS component: ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-test', templateUrl: './test.component.pug', styleUrls: ['./test.component.sass'] }) export class TestComponent { items = [ 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four' ]; } ``` Pug template: ```pug ul li(*ngFor="let item of items") {{item}} ``` I have the above example component and template in an Angular project. The project builds without issue using `ng build` and `ng-build --prod` The dev server starts without any issues using `ng serve` and the page renders as expected. Once I start making changes to the project and the dev server automatically rebuilds, it prints the following error: `Property 'item' does not exist on type 'TestComponent'. Did you mean 'items'?` The Angular application does appear to continue to work correctly and auto-rebuild on changes (printing that error every time), but these false errors can potentially hide legitimate ones. This happens with any variables generated with `*ngIf` or `*ngFor`. - `div(*ngIf="name$ | async as name") {{name}}`: the `{{name}}` portion will generate an error This issue occurs in both Angular 9 and 10. I have tried two different methods of adding pug support to my project, the error occurs with both: - Using https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular-builders/custom-webpack/v/9.2.0 to add a pug rule to webpack (using `apply-loader` and `pug-loader`) - This method is demonstrated in the Minimal Reproduction section below - Using https://www.npmjs.com/package/ng-cli-pug-loader/v/0.2.2 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Here is a repository resulting from the below steps: https://github.com/entith/ng-cli-pug-template-variable-issue 1. run `ng new test --minimal --skip-tests --style sass --routing` 2. switch to the generated project dir `cd test` 3. run `npm i -D @angular-builders/custom-webpack pug pug-loader apply-loader` 4. add `custom-webpack.config.js` file below 5. edit `angular.json` as per the `@angular-builders/custom-webpack` documentation to use `custom-webpack.config.js` - https://github.com/entith/ng-cli-pug-template-variable-issue/blob/master/angular.json 8. run `ng g component test` 9. edit the component and its template file to match the example above 10. run `ng serve` and wait for project to build - project should compile and server start with no errors - page should load in browser as expected 11. make any non-breaking change to a project file and save to trigger a rebuild - ex: add a space at the end of a line in the `test.component.pug` file - the project should rebuild, print `: Compiled successfully`, and then a moment later the error should print - the page should have correctly refeshed - if you make any template changes or changed the `items` array in the component, the page should correctly reflect these changes `custom-webpack.config.js`: ```javascript module.exports = (config, options, targetOptions) => { config.module.rules.push( { test: /\.pug$/, use: [ { loader: "apply-loader" }, { loader: "pug-loader" } ] } ); return config; }; ``` ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Bootstrap Module cannot be from library
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

I guess this is a bug but it could also be a feature request, since I am not exactly sure what the design decisions were.

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [x] build
- [x] serve

### Is this a regression?

No it is not.

### Description

We are implementing a lot of Microservices where each Service also contains their own frontend. We then have a shell application which collects information about all microservices and loads the frontends of those services into the shell so that they are usable for the user.

Each service also comes with a standalone mode, which currently is just a really small angular app that wraps the module which is normally lazy-loaded into the shell.

With time the requirement came, that the standalone shells of the services should contain some basic functionalities, which the main shell also provides, like for example a logout button or a forbidden page.

My intention was to create a npm library which contains a StandaloneShellModule, which acts as the AppModule for those standalone shells and provides those basic functionalities i mentioned above.

The original problem i faced, was that angular complained that my StandaloneShellModule is not part of the typescript compilation.

```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@company/shell/lib/standalone-shell.module.d.ts
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/index.js):
Error: D:\project\frontend\node_modules\@company\shell\lib\standalone-shell.module.d.ts is missing from the TypeScript compilation. Please make sure it is in your tsconfig via the 'files' or 'include' property.
The missing file seems to be part of a third party library. TS files in published libraries are often a sign of a badly packaged library. Please open an issue in the library repository to alert its author and ask them to package the library using the Angular Package Format (https://goo.gl/jB3GVv).
```

I then found out that the cli for some reason rewrites the imports for `platformBrowserDynamic` and the module given to `bootstrapModule`. The compiled main.js looked something like this.

```javascript
import * as __NgCli_bootstrap_1 from "./../node_modules/@company/shell/lib/standalone-shell.module.d";
import * as __NgCli_bootstrap_2 from "@angular/platform-browser";
if (environment.production) {
    enableProdMode();
}
__NgCli_bootstrap_2.platformBrowser().bootstrapModule(__NgCli_bootstrap_1.StandaloneShellModule)
```

I searched for the place where this happened in the cli and found this file.
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/transformers/replace_bootstrap.ts

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

I do not provide a reproduction, because the issue is more of a question why the CLI is designed this way and why it does not support third party modules to be bootstrapped.

## üî• Exception or Error

-

# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? From what I remember it didn't worked with angular 9 either ### Description . I'm using an old IPad 2 for development and just upgraded to angular 10. I'm using ngx-socket-io but I'm trying to build the project using `es5`. I followed the guideline for building es5 from [here](https://angular.io/guide/deployment#differential-builds) I notice that angular is using even in es5 the bundle fesm2015 of ngx-socket-io causing this unknown error. When running ng serve it says `compiling ngx-socket-io : es2015 as esm2015` I needed to use old safari in order to get the debugger working, so finding the precise error is kind of painful. notice that basic app using `ng new projectName` is working on my ipad. # üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ x] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
With our use case, we need 1 file without outputHashing, all the other should become hashed. It doesn't seem to be possible now without make a custom afterbuild step / custom webpack config.


### Describe the solution you'd like
In the angular.json, in the 'outputHashing' option, allow a regex || function to test the files for enabled/disabled hashing.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
Custom webpack with a custom 'AfterEmitPlugin' hook, that reverts the given file to a non-hashed filename.

Issues.Title: i18n - implement new ivy translation message extractor
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [x] xi18n

### Description
Integrate the message extraction tooling from `@angular/localize` into the CLI
For backward compatibility the old extraction should be used if `enableIvy: false`.

The new extraction works best if the application is build simply with `ngc`, with tsconfig set to generate ESM output and  source-maps, and the resulting JS files are passed to the message extractor. This is because the extractor relies upon source-mapping information to identify the original context of each extracted message, and bundling tends to mess up this mapping information. Also there is no need to waste processing on bundling and post-processing the code when all we want is to identify the `$localize` tagged messages.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n - implement new ivy translation message extractor" (#18275)

Issues.Title: FEATURE REQ: CDK Drag and Drop Thresholds and Nesting cdkDropList within cdkDrag
Issues.Body:
After a week with the drag and drop CDK I have chosen to go with SortableJS. I would like to propose some features for the CDK for future use.

SortableJS has a **thresholds** feature which is what I was looking for in the CDK's version. Not only can adding threshold tuning be an excellent upgrade but will pave the way for nested `cdkDropList`s.

Recap 2 related features:

1. Arrangement threshold to control when a dragging item triggers movement
2. Nesting `cdkDropList`s within `cdkDrag` is a missing feature driving developers away from the CDK and likely requires some type of threshold to integrate.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FEATURE REQ: CDK Drag and Drop Thresholds and Nesting cdkDropList within cdkDrag" (#20041)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-selection-list): Allow deselecting elements when multiple=False
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

I'd like to have a mat-selection-list where up to one element can be selected. Currently the list when multiple is set to false, the list can start with no selection, but as soon as an item is selected it will always have exactly one selection. I'd like to propose adding another toggle which controls if items can be deselected or not.

I can easily write up the trivial code here, I'm just not sure what an acceptable name for the property would be. allowToggling could work, but it might be confusing for the multiple selection lists where presumably it shouldn't take effect.

Issues.Title: build: do not upload results to cloud result-store by default
Issues.Body:
We currently always upload build results to `source.cloud.google.com`.
Though past has proven that servers for the Build Event Service are
rather unstable compared to the remote execution workers we acquire
for CI builds. To avoid that these servers and the non-build relevant
result uploading degrades CI stability, we do not run them by default,
unless one explicitly opts-in through a Bazel build configuration.

The uploaded build results were useful to inspect output of individual
targets that ran on CI, but the need for this is limited, and if someone
cannot see given output for an action, he could easily connect to the CI
container and run the command manually. Usually the output for failed
actions is printed to the CI output anyway.

Motivation for this change: As explained, instability of these servers. I have
noticed such failures frequently over the past months (not often; but noticeable).
Today it's significantly impeding PR statuses, most likely due to a larger GCP outage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: do not upload results to cloud result-store by default" (#20034)

Issues.Title: ci: report size-test failures to separate slack channel
Issues.Body:

should be handled in a separate channel.

Issues.Title: build: increase timeout for legacy saucelabs tests
Issues.Body:
We keep adding more tests to our codebase, but browsers
on Saucelabs generally run slow. During the last couple of
weeks unit tests on Saucelabs sometimes failed due to the default 10min
timeout. e.g. https://app.saucelabs.com/tests/bfb7ade4b0fc4e7e9ff7237074baac80

We bump the timeout so that tests can complete without us relaunching
another instance of a browser (which might pass; but will increase CI
duration even more). We use the maximum value of 1000seconds.

Ideally we'll fix this in the future by having incremental test runs.
I'm working on this with a Bazel setup as a side project. See:
https://github.com/angular/components/pull/19409
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: increase timeout for legacy saucelabs tests" (#20029)

Issues.Title: build: increase timeout for resultstore build uploads
Issues.Body:
We upload build results to Google Cloud `ResultStore`. Sometimes this
seems to fail though and Bazel CI jobs exit red. This could be due to
BES servers being slow, or servers being unreliably. Given that remote
executors from GCP are behaving fine though, we try increasing the
timeout first. We can disable the uploading if it doesn't get better.

For context: We upload to result store / source.cloud.google.com so that
CI builds with Bazel can be debugged better. e.g. 

https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/410a5790-54eb-43e8-96eb-c3cfa0f8960d
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: increase timeout for resultstore build uploads" (#20027)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-card): buttons in mat-card-actions do not consider its align attribute
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-ampt5f?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.css Steps to reproduce: 1. Add a card with 2 or more buttons in `mat-card-actions` 2. Inspect space between them #### Actual behavior #### Expected behavior #### Proposed fix Based on `align=start` or `align=end`, the first or the last button should be applied the style which is right now applied to the first button regardless: This can be solved by the following snippet: ``` .mat-card-actions .mat-button, .mat-card-actions .mat-raised-button, .mat-card-actions .mat-stroked-button { margin: 0 8px !important; } .mat-card-actions[align="end"] .mat-button:last-child, .mat-card-actions[align="end"] .mat-raised-button:last-child, .mat-card-actions[align="end"] .mat-stroked-button:last-child { margin: 0 !important; } .mat-card-actions[align="start"] .mat-button:first-child, .mat-card-actions[align="start"] .mat-raised-button:first-child, .mat-card-actions[align="start"] .mat-stroked-button:first-child { margin: 0 !important; } ``` #### Similar/related issues I found: #18391 #13382 #### Environment - Angular: 10 - CDK/Material: 10 - Browser(s): Safari, Chrome, Firefox latest - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-card): buttons in mat-card-actions do not consider its align attribute" (#20024)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): Select looses focus when activating one of children via mouse
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-fjmby9 (watch red/green boolean in toolbar)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have `mat-select` with `mat-options`
2. Click on one of the options
a. option gets de-selected
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

When clicking on options of select, the select gets de-focused.


#### Actual Behavior

When select is opened, its focus status is locked to true, until it gets closed. Upon closing the focus should be decided, whenever the focus is to be kept or not. 

Clicking outside of options defocuses, esc keeps focus on select. This is the same as native select and how it works in mat-select now.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.3
- CDK/Material: 10.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): WIndows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-select): Select looses focus when activating one of children via mouse" (#20022)

Issues.Title: refactor: do not manually modify properties of keyboard events in tests
Issues.Body:
We have common helpers for dealing with events. In the past, the
keyboard event helpers did not support modifier keys, but we added
such functionality. Existing tests should not use `Object.defineProperty`,
to set modifier keys. Instead tests should just pass the desired
modifier keys to the `createKeyboardEvent` helper call.

This commit cleans this up. Additionally, it fixes an incorrect method
description for the `createKeyboardEvent` helper while also cleaning up
that the helper undesirably accepts a `target` element. The event target
is always automatically set when the event is dispatched on a given
element. If this is not desired in some situations (as with the chips
tests), then the event target needs to be manually set. It's not typical
to do this though, so the helper should not have this API (as it also
complicates the keyboard event tests of other components; plus it's
inconsistent with other event helpers we expose).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: do not manually modify properties of keyboard events in tests" (#20021)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-calendar): The dateClass callback is not called then in month view.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Have a mat-calendar like:
```
              <mat-calendar
                [minDate]="today"
                [maxDate]="serviceMaxDate"
                [dateFilter]="filterDates"
                [dateClass]="classDates"
                [selected]="selectedDate"
                (selectedChange)="selectedDateChanges($event)">
              </mat-calendar>
```
2. Select -> years (on top) -> select a year -> then dateFilter is called (for all year dates) but the dateClass is not. So I don't get css classes on months cells.  
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I should be able to put css classes on month cells just like the days cells.


#### Actual Behavior

Only while in date view the dateClass callback is called for all month days.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4,
- Browser(s): Chrome 83+
- Operating System: Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-calendar): The dateClass callback is not called then in month view." (#20017)
